name: Forest
description: Forest consists of a continuous stand of trees and includes both forested areas (generally with a closed canopy) and wooded areas.

name: Savanna
description: Savannas are transitional between grasslands and forests. They are ecosystems dominated by a grass ground cover with an overstorey of widely spaced trees and shrubs.

name: Grassland
description: Native grasslands are comprised of grasses and broadleaved herbaceous plants, and are either without woody plants, or the latter are very sparsely distributed.

name: Wetlands
description: Areas of marsh, fen, peatland or water, whether natural or artificial, permanent or temporary, with water that is static or flowing, fresh, brackish or salt, including areas of marine water the depth of which at low tide does not exceed six meters.

name: Desert
description: Consists of arid landscapes with a sparse plant cover, except in depressions where water accumulates. The sandy, stony, or rocky substrate contributes more to the appearance of the landscape than does the vegetation.
thr_high: Sparse vegetation (tree, shrub,herbaceous cover)(<15%); Bare areas

description: Includes cereal fields, rice paddies, perennial crops, orchards and groves.

name: Artificial arable and pasture lands: Pastureland
description: Includes fertilized or re-seeded permanent grasslands, sometimes treated with selective herbicides, with very impoverished flora and fauna. Also includes secondary grasslands and wooded farmland.

name: Artificial degraded forest and plantation: Plantations
description: A plantation is an intentional planting of a crop, on a larger scale, usually for uses other than cereal production or pasture. The term is currently most often used for plantings of trees and shrubs. The term tends also to be used for plantings maintained on economic bases other than that of subsistence farming.

name: Artificial degraded forest and plantation: Degraded Forest
description: Former subtropical or tropical forest that has been extensively cleared or impacted by human activities. Often there is some degree of regeneration or there are small fragments of forest remaining.
